questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
options: Computer Style Sheets
Cascading Style Sheets
Colorful Style Sheets
Creative Style System

questions.question: What does HTML stand for, and what is its main purpose?
options: HyperText Markup Language; it structures web content using tags for elements like headings, paragraphs, links, and images.
Hyperlinks and Text Markup Language; it controls a page’s visual design and layout.
Home Tool Markup Language; it makes websites interactive and handles user input validation on the server.
High-Level Text Management Language; it manages databases for websites.

questions.question: What is the difference between a website and a webpage?
options: A webpage is a single document on the internet; a website is a collection of related webpages under one domain.
They are the same thing; the terms are interchangeable.
A website is a single document, while a webpage is a collection of sites.
A webpage is the physical server; a website is the file stored on it.

questions.question: What is the difference between frontend and backend development?
options: Frontend builds the user interface with HTML/CSS/JS; backend handles server logic and databases using languages like Python, Java, or Node.js.
Frontend runs on servers and manages databases; backend renders buttons and forms in the browser.
Frontend and backend are identical; both only style web pages.
Backend runs entirely in the browser; frontend runs only on the server.

questions.question: Pick the correct way to include an external CSS file:
options: <style src="styles.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
<css href="styles.css">
@css("styles.css")

questions.question: What is JavaScript used for in web development?
options: Adding interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages (e.g., responding to user actions, updating content without refresh, validating forms).
Structuring content on the web using semantic tags.
Designing the visual layout of pages with styles and typography.
Managing server hardware resources directly.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a frontend technology?
options: React.js
Node.js
MySQL
Python

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a backend technology?
options: Angular
CSS
Node.js
HTML

questions.question: What does "responsive design" mean?
options: Designing websites so they work well on different screen sizes and devices.
Optimizing servers to respond faster to HTTP requests.
Building pages that respond only to server-side events.
Creating native mobile apps instead of web pages.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an API?
options: To allow different software applications to communicate and interact with each other.
To style web pages and control typography.
To store and back up user files on a web server.
To speed up the CPU so pages load faster.

questions.question: What does the <script> tag do in HTML?
options: Links or embeds JavaScript into an HTML document.
Applies CSS styles to a webpage.
Defines metadata about the document.
Links to external web pages.

questions.question: What’s the purpose of a rendering engine like Blink or WebKit?
options: It converts HTML, CSS, and JavaScript into a visual webpage.
It compiles backend code for faster performance.
It translates database queries into API responses.
It encrypts JavaScript for security.

questions.question: What is the difference between inline and block elements?
options: Inline elements don’t start a new line; block elements do.
Block elements don’t start a new line; inline elements do.
Both types always start a new line.
Neither affects layout.

questions.question: What does DOM stand for in web development?
options: Document Object Model; it represents the structure of a web page.
Digital Object Module; it handles JavaScript imports.
Document Order Management; it handles page caching.
Display Output Matrix; it handles UI rendering.

questions.question: What is an API used for in web apps?
options: It allows different systems to exchange data.
It styles web pages using CSS.
It defines the navigation layout.
It stores cookies for user sessions.

questions.question: What is a framework in web development?
options: A pre-built structure or set of tools that helps developers build applications faster.
A type of database for storing user data.
A text editor for writing code.
A testing library for debugging.

questions.question: What does a 404 status code mean?
options: Page not found.
Server error.
Request successful.
Redirect to homepage.

questions.question: What does SEO improve?
options: Website visibility and ranking on search engines.
Server speed and response time.
The visual design of a webpage.
Database query optimization.

questions.question: What does the alt attribute in an tag do?
options: Provides alternative text if the image cannot be displayed.
Sets image size.
Defines image border color.
Links the image to a CSS file.

questions.question: What does the <meta> tag define?
options: Page information like description or viewport settings.
Links to JavaScript files.
Defines the layout grid.
Sets up user authentication.

questions.question: What does position: absolute; do?
options: Positions an element freely within its parent container.
Keeps an element fixed relative to the viewport.
Centers an element horizontally only.
Creates a new flex container.

questions.question: Which CSS layout is one-dimensional?
options: Flexbox
Grid
Table
Float

questions.question: Which layout system is two-dimensional?
options: Grid
Flexbox
Float
Inline-block

questions.question: What tool is used for version control?
options: Git
NPM
Webpack
VS Code

questions.question: What command is used to clone a repository in Git?
options: git clone
git pull
git init
git copy

questions.question: What is the difference between == and === in JavaScript?
options: === checks both value and type; == checks only value.
They are identical; both check value and type.
== checks both value and type; === checks only value.
== is used only for strings; === for numbers.

questions.question: What does asynchronous mean in JavaScript?
options: Code runs without blocking other operations.
Code executes line by line synchronously.
JavaScript runs only on the server.
The script must finish before another starts.

questions.question: What is caching used for?
options: To store temporary data and load pages faster.
To delete old files from a server.
To backup databases automatically.
To encrypt user passwords.

questions.question: What is the purpose of JSON in web development?
options: To transfer and store structured data between a client and a server.
To style pages dynamically.
To control browser rendering speed.
To compile backend code.

questions.question: What is npm used for?
options: Installing and managing project dependencies and packages.
Hosting websites online.
Editing HTML files.
Creating CSS animations.
